comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I wonder if he was around today,  'E. Beyer' might flog his boots on eBay.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Well spotted!!! Your eyes are clearly better than mine. However its not Beyer but Deyer Dever. Edward Deyer Dever is listed in Sands (1888) as a bootmaker trading from 68 Cumberland Street. - www3.photosau.com/CoSSands/scripts/home.asp (see Trades and Professional - European Manufacturers, p. 854) WARNING: The downloads are mighty big (but mighty useful!) 56 Cumberland Street, The Rocks (NSW) (October 1901) [SRNSW: 4481_a026_000104] Cumberland Street from No.60 looking south, The Rocks (NSW) (undated) [SRNSW: 4481_a026_000219]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] THAT IS SO B R I L L I A N T !
I had a hunch you would come up with the answer.  Well done!  
It is good when things just . . . dovetail.

And my corny joke now looks very corny!

comment.author: 61753330@N06
comment._content: I 'think' this bootmaker owned the hotel across the street, known as the "jack's delight" there is an advertisement in the SMH of a bootmaker at that location at that time who owned the 'former hotel', I will try to locate it.
